p: In the first stage, we prepared the ligands for molecular docking with target proteases. We compiled a library of 14,011 phytochemicals produced by medicinal plants used in traditional Indian medicine, and the main source of this compilation was IMPPAT [ 28], the largest resource on phytochemicals of Indian herbs to date (see Section 3). Next, the standard drug-likeness measure, Lipinskiâ€™s rule of five (RO5) [ 29], was used to filter a subset of 10,510 drug-like phytochemicals. Next, the filtered phytochemicals were prepared for docking by retrieving their 3D structures from Pubchem [ 30] followed by energy-minimization using OpenBabel [ 31] ( Section 3).
